com.radirius.mercury.graphics

Class Batcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radirius.mercury.graphics.Batcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable, Initializable, Usable

    public class Batcher
extends Object
implements Initializable, Cleanable, Usable
    An OpenGL batcher that manages and pushes vertices.
    Author:
    wessles, Jeviny, Sri Harsha Chilakapati

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Batcher.VertexData
      A class to hold the data of a vertex (position, color, and source coordinates).

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Uploads data to OpenGL.

      • flushOnOverflow

        public void flushOnOverflow(int allocate)
        Calls flush() if allocated amount of vertices exceed the limit. If you don't call this before you draw one or more shapes, it could result in a shape being split into two data flushes.
        Parameters:
        allocate - The amount of vertices you will draw

      • getVerticesLastRendered

        public int getVerticesLastRendered()
        Returns The amount of vertices rendered in the last frame

      • begin

        public void begin()
        Pre rendering code. Activates batcher.
        Specified by:
        begin in interface Usable

      • end

        public void end()
        Post rendering code. Deactivates batcher.
        Specified by:
        end in interface Usable

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns Whether the batcher is in use (between begin() and end() calls)

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(Texture texture)
        Sets the texture at active index 0 (default OpenGL texture).
        Parameters:
        texture - The texture to set

      • activateTexture

        public void activateTexture(int activateIndex)
        Sets the active texture using glActiveTexture().
        Parameters:
        activateIndex - The activation index (0 is GL_TEXTURE0, 1 is GL_TEXTURE1, etc.)

      • clearTextures

        public void clearTextures()
        Sets the texture to a blank default (not to be confused with unbinding; this sets the texture to an empty black texture).

      • getTexture

        public Texture getTexture()
        Returns The last set texture

               float sx1,

               float x,
               float y,
               float w,
               float h)
        Draws a texture.
        Parameters:
        texture - The texture to draw
        sx1 - The near source x coordinate
        sy1 - The near source y coordinate
        sx2 - The far source x coordinate
        sy2 - The far source y coordinate

        y - The y position
        w - The width
        h - The height

      • vertex

        public void vertex(float x,
          float y,
          float r,
          float g,
          float b,
          float u,
          float v)
        Adds a new vertex to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position
        y - The y position
        r - The red value of the color of the vertex (0.0-1.0)
        g - The green value of the color of the vertex (0.0-1.0)
        b - The blue value of the color of the vertex (0.0-1.0)
        u - The source x coordinate
        v - The source y coordinate

      • vertex

        public void vertex(float x,
          float y,
          float r,
          float g,
          float b,
          float a,
          float u,
          float v)
        Adds a new vertex to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position
        y - The y position
        r - The red value of the color of the vertex (0.0-1.0)
        g - The green value of the color of the vertex (0.0-1.0)
        b - The blue value of the color of the vertex (0.0-1.0)
        a - The alpha value of the color of the vertex (0.0-1.0)
        u - The source x coordinate
        v - The source y coordinate

      • vertex

        public void vertex(Batcher.VertexData vdo)
        Adds a new vertex to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        vdo - The data of the vertex (position, color, and source coordinates)
